1.Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
1.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen
1.Outline: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

2.Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
2.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Orlando Bloom
2.Outline: A meek Hobbit and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the One Ring and the Dark Lord Sauron.

3.Name: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
3.Credit: Dir: Irvin Kershner With: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher
3.Outline: After the rebels have been brutally overpowered by the Empire on their newly established base, Luke Skywalker takes advanced Jedi training with Master Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader as part of his plan to capture Luke.

4.Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
4.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Viggo Mortensen
4.Outline: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

5.Name: Star Wars
5.Credit: Dir: George Lucas With: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher
5.Outline: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle-station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the evil Darth Vader.

6.Name: It's a Wonderful Life
6.Credit: Dir: Frank Capra With: James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore
6.Outline: An angel helps a compassionate but despairingly frustrated businessman by showing what life would have been like if he never existed.

7.Name: Spirited Away
7.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Daveigh Chase, Suzanne Pleshette, Miyu Irino
7.Outline: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

8.Name: Baahubali: The Beginning
8.Credit: Dir: S.S. Rajamouli With: Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty
8.Outline: In ancient India, an adventurous and daring man becomes involved in a decades old feud between two warring people.

9.Name: The Green Mile
9.Credit: Dir: Frank Darabont With: Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse
9.Outline: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.

10.Name: Princess Mononoke
10.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: YÃ´ji Matsuda, Yuriko Ishida, YÃ»ko Tanaka
10.Outline: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.

11.Name: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
11.Credit: Dir: Richard Marquand With: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher
11.Outline: After rescuing Han Solo from the palace of Jabba the Hutt, the rebels attempt to destroy the second Death Star, while Luke struggles to make Vader return from the dark side of the Force.

12.Name: Toy Story 3
12.Credit: Dir: Lee Unkrich With: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Joan Cusack
12.Outline: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

13.Name: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
13.Credit: Dir: Terry Gilliam, Terry Jones With: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle
13.Outline: King Arthur and his knights embark on a low-budget search for the Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.

14.Name: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens
14.Credit: Dir: J.J. Abrams With: Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Oscar Isaac
14.Outline: Three decades after the defeat of the Galactic Empire, a new threat arises. The First Order attempts to rule the galaxy and only a ragtag group of heroes can stop them, along with the help of the Resistance.

15.Name: OMG: Oh My God!
15.Credit: Dir: Umesh Shukla With: Paresh Rawal, Mithun Chakraborty, Akshay Kumar
15.Outline: A shopkeeper takes God to court when his shop is destroyed by an earthquake.

16.Name: Toy Story
16.Credit: Dir: John Lasseter With: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Don Rickles
16.Outline: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.

17.Name: Inside Out
17.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Drama | Family | Fantasy
17.Credit: Dir: Pete Docter, Ronnie Del Carmen With: Amy Poehler, Bill Hader, Lewis Black
17.Outline: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

18.Name: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
18.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody
18.Outline: When Dr. Henry Jones Sr. suddenly goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, eminent archaeologist Indiana Jones must follow in his father's footsteps and stop the Nazis.

19.Name: My Neighbor Totoro
19.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Hitoshi Takagi, Noriko Hidaka, Chika Sakamoto
19.Outline: When two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother, they have adventures with the wonderous forest spirits who live nearby.

20.Name: The Seventh Seal
20.Credit: Dir: Ingmar Bergman With: Max von Sydow, Gunnar BjÃ¶rnstrand, Bengt Ekerot
20.Outline: A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

21.Name: Pan's Labyrinth
21.Credit: Dir: Guillermo del Toro With: Ivana Baquero, Ariadna Gil, Sergi LÃ³pez
21.Outline: In the falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

22.Name: Howl's Moving Castle
22.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Chieko BaishÃ´, Takuya Kimura, Tatsuya GashÃ»in
22.Outline: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.

23.Name: How to Train Your Dragon
23.Credit: Dir: Dean DeBlois, Chris Sanders With: Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, Christopher Mintz-Plasse
23.Outline: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons, becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.

24.Name: The Princess Bride
24.Credit: Dir: Rob Reiner With: Cary Elwes, Mandy Patinkin, Robin Wright
24.Outline: While home sick in bed, a young boy's grandfather reads him a story called The Princess Bride.

25.Name: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
25.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Sumi Shimamoto, Mahito Tsujimura, Hisako KyÃ´da
25.Outline: Warrior/pacifist Princess NausicaÃ¤ desperately struggles to prevent two warring nations from destroying themselves and their dying planet.

26.Name: 8½
26.Credit: Dir: Federico Fellini With: Marcello Mastroianni, Anouk AimÃ©e, Claudia Cardinale
26.Outline: A harried movie director retreats into his memories and fantasies.

27.Name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
27.Credit: Dir: David Yates With: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
27.Outline: Harry, Ron and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

28.Name: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
28.Credit: Dir: Robert Wiene With: Werner Krauss, Conrad Veidt, Friedrich Feher
28.Outline: Dr. Caligari's somnambulist, Cesare, and his deadly predictions.

29.Name: Wings of Desire
29.Credit: Dir: Wim Wenders With: Bruno Ganz, Solveig Dommartin, Otto Sander
29.Outline: An angel tires of overseeing human activity and wishes to become human when he falls in love with a mortal.

30.Name: Castle in the Sky
30.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Anna Paquin, James Van Der Beek, Cloris Leachman
30.Outline: A young boy and a girl with a magic crystal must race against pirates and foreign agents in a search for a legendary floating castle.

31.Name: The Wizard of Oz
31.Credit: Dir: Victor Fleming With: Judy Garland, Frank Morgan, Ray Bolger
31.Outline: Dorothy Gale is swept away to a magical land in a tornado and embarks on a quest to see the Wizard who can help her return home.

32.Name: Harvey
32.Credit: Dir: Henry Koster With: James Stewart, Josephine Hull, Peggy Dow
32.Outline: Due to his insistence that he has an invisible six-foot rabbit for a best friend, a whimsical middle-aged man is thought by his family to be insane - but he may be wiser than anyone knows.

33.Name: Monsters, Inc.
33.Credit: Dir: Pete Docter, David Silverman With: Billy Crystal, John Goodman, Mary Gibbs
33.Outline: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

34.Name: Groundhog Day
34.Credit: Dir: Harold Ramis With: Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott
34.Outline: A weatherman finds himself living the same day over and over again.

35.Name: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
35.Credit: Dir: Gore Verbinski With: Johnny Depp, Geoffrey Rush, Orlando Bloom
35.Outline: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

36.Name: Beauty and the Beast
36.Credit: Dir: Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise With: Paige O'Hara, Robby Benson, Jesse Corti
36.Outline: Belle, whose father is imprisoned by the Beast, offers herself instead, unaware her captor to be an enchanted prince.

37.Name: The Nightmare Before Christmas
37.Credit: Dir: Henry Selick With: Danny Elfman, Chris Sarandon, Catherine O'Hara
37.Outline: Jack Skellington, king of Halloween Town, discovers Christmas Town, but doesn't quite understand the concept.

38.Name: Big Fish
38.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton With: Ewan McGregor, Albert Finney, Billy Crudup
38.Outline: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.

39.Name: Nosferatu
39.Credit: Dir: F.W. Murnau With: Max Schreck, Greta SchrÃ¶der, Ruth Landshoff
39.Outline: Vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Hutter's wife.

40.Name: Aladdin
40.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Musical | Romance
40.Credit: Dir: Ron Clements, John Musker With: Scott Weinger, Robin Williams, Linda Larkin
40.Outline: When a street urchin vies for the love of a beautiful princess, he uses a genie's magic power to make himself off as a prince in order to marry her.

41.Name: Ratatouille
41.Credit: Dir: Brad Bird, Jan Pinkava With: Brad Garrett, Lou Romano, Patton Oswalt
41.Outline: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous restaurant.

42.Name: The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
42.Credit: Dir: Luis BuÃ±uel With: Fernando Rey, Delphine Seyrig, Paul Frankeur
42.Outline: A surreal, virtually plotless series of dreams centered around six middle-class people and their consistently interrupted attempts to have a meal together.

43.Name: Life of Pi
43.Credit: Dir: Ang Lee With: Suraj Sharma, Irrfan Khan, Adil Hussain
43.Outline: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

44.Name: King Kong
44.Credit: With: Fay Wray, Robert Armstrong, Bruce Cabot
44.Outline: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal giant gorilla who takes a shine to their female blonde star. Then he's captured and brought back to New York City for public exhibition.

45.Name: Edward Scissorhands
45.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton With: Johnny Depp, Winona Ryder, Dianne Wiest
45.Outline: A gentle man, with scissors for hands, is brought into a new community after living in isolation.

46.Name: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
46.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage
46.Outline: A reluctant hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home - and the gold within it - from the dragon Smaug.

47.Name: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
47.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage
47.Outline: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.

48.Name: Toy Story 2
48.Credit: Dir: John Lasseter, Ash Brannon With: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Joan Cusack
48.Outline: When Woody is stolen by a toy collector, Buzz and his friends vow to rescue him, but Woody finds the idea of immortality in a museum tempting.

49.Name: Ninja Scroll
49.Credit: Dir: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Kevin Seymour With: Stephen Apostolina, Dean Wein, Wendee Lee
49.Outline: A mysterious vagabond sets out on a journey to confront his past. Little does he know he is up against a demonic force of killers, with a ghost from his past as the leader.

50.Name: The Fall
50.Credit: Dir: Tarsem Singh With: Lee Pace, Catinca Untaru, Justine Waddell
50.Outline: In a hospital on the outskirts of 1920s Los Angeles, an injured stuntman begins to tell a fellow patient, a little girl with a broken arm, a fantastic story of five mythical heroes. Thanks to his fractured state of mind and her vivid imagination, the line between fiction and reality blurs as the tale advances.

51.Name: How to Train Your Dragon 2
51.Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy
51.Credit: Dir: Dean DeBlois With: Jay Baruchel, Cate Blanchett, Gerard Butler
51.Outline: When Hiccup and Toothless discover an ice cave that is home to hundreds of new wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace.

52.Name: Mr. Nobody
52.Credit: Dir: Jaco Van Dormael With: Jared Leto, Sarah Polley, Diane Kruger
52.Outline: A boy stands on a station platform as a train is about to leave. Should he go with his mother or stay with his father? Infinite possibilities arise from this decision. As long as he doesn't choose, anything is possible.

53.Name: The Double Life of Veronique
53.Credit: Dir: Krzysztof Kieslowski With: IrÃ¨ne Jacob, Wladyslaw Kowalski, Halina Gryglaszewska
53.Outline: Two parallel stories about two identical women; one living in Poland, the other in France. They don't know each other, but their lives are nevertheless profoundly connected.

54.Name: Shrek
54.Credit: Dir: Andrew Adamson, Vicky Jenson With: Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz
54.Outline: After his swamp is filled with magical creatures, an ogre agrees to rescue a princess for a villainous lord in order to get his land back.

55.Name: The Ten Commandments
55.Credit: Dir: Cecil B. DeMille With: Charlton Heston, Yul Brynner, Anne Baxter
55.Outline: The Egyptian Prince, Moses, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

56.Name: Avatar
56.Credit: Dir: James Cameron With: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver
56.Outline: A paraplegic marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

57.Name: Kiki's Delivery Service
57.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Kirsten Dunst, Minami Takayama, Rei Sakuma
57.Outline: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service.

58.Name: About Time
58.Credit: Dir: Richard Curtis With: Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams, Bill Nighy
58.Outline: At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. His decision to make his world a better place by getting a girlfriend turns out not to be as easy as you might think.

59.Name: Evil Dead II
59.Credit: Dir: Sam Raimi With: Bruce Campbell, Sarah Berry, Dan Hicks
59.Outline: The lone survivor of an onslaught of flesh-possessing spirits holds up in a cabin with a group of strangers while the demons continue their attack.

60.Name: Waking Life
60.Credit: Dir: Richard Linklater With: Ethan Hawke, Trevor Jack Brooks, Lorelei Linklater
60.Outline: A man shuffles through a dream meeting various people and discussing the meanings and purposes of the universe.

61.Name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
61.Credit: Dir: Mel Stuart With: Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson, Peter Ostrum
61.Outline: Charlie receives a golden ticket to a factory, his sweet tooth wants going into the lushing candy, it turns out there's an adventure in everything.

62.Name: Fantasia
62.Credit: Dir: Norman Ferguson With: Leopold Stokowski, Deems Taylor, Corey Burton
62.Outline: A collection of animated interpretations of great works of Western classical music.

63.Name: Tangled
63.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Musical | Romance
63.Credit: Dir: Nathan Greno, Byron Howard With: Mandy Moore, Zachary Levi, Donna Murphy
63.Outline: The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is.

64.Name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
64.Credit: Dir: Alfonso CuarÃ³n With: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
64.Outline: It's Harry's third year at Hogwarts; not only does he have a new "Defense Against the Dark Arts" teacher, but there is also trouble brewing. Convicted murderer Sirius Black has escaped the Wizards' Prison and is coming after Harry.

65.Name: Ghostbusters
65.Credit: Dir: Ivan Reitman With: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Sigourney Weaver
65.Outline: Three former parapsychology professors set up shop as a unique ghost removal service.

66.Name: Porco Rosso
66.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: ShÃ»ichirÃ´ Moriyama, Tokiko KatÃ´, Bunshi Katsura Vi
66.Outline: The adventures of "Porco Rosso", a veteran WW1 pilot in 1930s Italy, who has been cursed to look like an anthropomorphic pig.

67.Name: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
67.Credit: Dir: David Fincher With: Brad Pitt, Cate Blanchett, Tilda Swinton
67.Outline: Tells the story of Benjamin Button, a man who starts aging backwards with bizarre consequences.

68.Name: The Lego Movie
68.Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy
68.Credit: Dir: Phil Lord, Christopher Miller With: Chris Pratt, Will Ferrell, Elizabeth Banks
68.Outline: An ordinary Lego construction worker, thought to be the prophesied 'Special', is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil tyrant from gluing the Lego universe into eternal stasis.

69.Name: Mary Poppins
69.Credit: Dir: Robert Stevenson With: Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, David Tomlinson
69.Outline: A magic nanny comes to work for a cold banker's unhappy family.

70.Name: Kung Fu Hustle
70.Credit: Dir: Stephen Chow With: Stephen Chow, Wah Yuen, Qiu Yuen
70.Outline: In Shanghai, China in the 1940s, a wannabe gangster aspires to join the notorious "Axe Gang" while residents of a housing complex exhibit extraordinary powers in defending their turf.

71.Name: South Park: Bigger Longer & Uncut
71.Credit: Dir: Trey Parker With: Trey Parker, Matt Stone, Mary Kay Bergman
71.Outline: When the four boys see an R-rated movie featuring Canadians Terrance & Phillip, they are pronounced "corrupted", and their parents pressure the United States to wage war against Canada.

72.Name: Being John Malkovich
72.Credit: Dir: Spike Jonze With: John Cusack, Cameron Diaz, Catherine Keener
72.Outline: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of the movie star, John Malkovich .

73.Name: The Purple Rose of Cairo
73.Credit: Dir: Woody Allen With: Mia Farrow, Jeff Daniels, Danny Aiello
73.Outline: In New Jersey in 1935, a movie character walks off the screen and into the real world.

74.Credit: Dir: Zack Snyder With: Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, David Wenham
74.Outline: King Leonidas of Sparta and a force of 300 men fight the Persians at Thermopylae in 480 B.C.

75.Name: Dark City
75.Genre: Action | Drama | Fantasy | Mystery | Sci-Fi | Thriller
75.Credit: Dir: Alex Proyas With: Rufus Sewell, Kiefer Sutherland, Jennifer Connelly
75.Outline: A man struggles with memories of his past, including a wife he cannot remember, in a nightmarish world with no sun.

76.Name: Stardust
76.Credit: Dir: Matthew Vaughn With: Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Sienna Miller
76.Outline: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.

77.Name: Dead Man
77.Credit: Dir: Jim Jarmusch With: Johnny Depp, Gary Farmer, Crispin Glover
77.Outline: On the run after murdering a man, accountant William Blake encounters a strange North American man named Nobody who prepares him for his journey into the spiritual world.

78.Name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
78.Credit: Dir: David Yates With: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
78.Outline: As Harry races against time and evil to destroy the Horcruxes, he uncovers the existence of three most powerful objects in the wizarding world: the Deathly Hallows.

79.Name: Ponyo
79.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Cate Blanchett, Matt Damon, Liam Neeson
79.Outline: An adventure about a five-year-old boy and his relationship with Ponyo, a goldfish princess who longs to become a human after falling in love with him.

80.Name: Coraline
80.Credit: Dir: Henry Selick With: Dakota Fanning, Teri Hatcher, John Hodgman
80.Outline: An adventurous girl finds another world that is a strangely idealized version of her frustrating home, but it has sinister secrets.

81.Name: The Muppet Christmas Carol
81.Credit: Dir: Brian Henson With: Michael Caine, Dave Goelz, Steve Whitmire
81.Outline: The Muppet characters tell their version of the classic tale of an old and bitter miser's redemption on Christmas Eve.

82.Name: The City of Lost Children
82.Credit: Dir: Marc Caro, Jean-Pierre Jeunet With: Ron Perlman, Daniel Emilfork, Judith Vittet
82.Outline: A scientist in a surrealist society kidnaps children to steal their dreams, hoping that they slow his aging process.

83.Name: Who Framed Roger Rabbit
83.Credit: Dir: Robert Zemeckis With: Bob Hoskins, Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy
83.Outline: A toon-hating detective is a cartoon rabbit's only hope to prove his innocence when he is accused of murder.

84.Name: Midnight in Paris
84.Credit: Dir: Woody Allen With: Owen Wilson, Rachel McAdams, Kathy Bates
84.Outline: While on a trip to Paris with his fiancÃ©e's family, a nostalgic screenwriter finds himself mysteriously going back to the 1920s everyday at midnight.

85.Name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
85.Credit: Dir: William Cottrell, David Hand With: Adriana Caselotti, Harry Stockwell, Lucille La Verne
85.Outline: Snow White, pursued by a jealous queen, hides with the Dwarfs, but the queen learns of this and prepares to feed her a poison apple.

86.Name: The Secret World of Arrietty
86.Credit: Dir: Hiromasa Yonebayashi With: Bridgit Mendler, Amy Poehler, Will Arnett
86.Outline: The Clock family are four-inch-tall people who live anonymously in another family's residence, borrowing simple items to make their home. Life changes for the Clocks when their daughter, Arrietty, is discovered.

87.Name: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
87.Credit: Dir: Mike Newell With: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
87.Outline: Harry finds himself mysteriously selected as an under-aged competitor in a dangerous tournament between three schools of magic.

88.Name: Stranger Than Fiction
88.Credit: Dir: Marc Forster With: Will Ferrell, Emma Thompson, Dustin Hoffman
88.Outline: An IRS auditor suddenly finds himself the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire life, from his work, to his love-interest, to his death.

89.Name: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
89.Credit: Dir: George Lucas With: Hayden Christensen, Natalie Portman, Ewan McGregor
89.Outline: During the near end of the clone wars, Darth Sidious has revealed himself and is ready to execute the last part of his plan to rule the Galaxy...

90.Name: The Haunting
90.Credit: Dir: Robert Wise With: Julie Harris, Claire Bloom, Richard Johnson
90.Outline: A scientist doing research on the paranormal invites two women to a haunted mansion. One of the participants soon starts losing her mind.

91.Name: The Crow
91.Credit: Dir: Alex Proyas With: Brandon Lee, Michael Wincott, Rochelle Davis
91.Outline: A man brutally murdered comes back to life as an undead avenger of his and his fiancÃ©e's murder.

92.Name: Dracula
92.Credit: Dir: Tod Browning With: Bela Lugosi, Helen Chandler, David Manners
92.Outline: The ancient vampire Count Dracula arrives in England and begins to prey upon the virtuous young Mina.

93.Name: The Others
93.Credit: Dir: Alejandro AmenÃ¡bar With: Nicole Kidman, Christopher Eccleston, Fionnula Flanagan
93.Outline: A woman who lives in a darkened old house with her two photosensitive children becomes convinced that her family home is haunted.

94.Name: Army of Darkness
94.Credit: Dir: Sam Raimi With: Bruce Campbell, Embeth Davidtz, Marcus Gilbert
94.Outline: A man is accidentally transported to 1300 A.D., where he must battle an army of the dead and retrieve the Necronomicon so he can return home.

95.Name: The Secret of NIMH
95.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Sci-Fi
95.Credit: Dir: Don Bluth With: Elizabeth Hartman, Derek Jacobi, Dom DeLuise
95.Outline: To save her ill son, a field mouse must seek the aid of a colony of rats, with whom she has a deeper link than she ever suspected.

96.Name: Frozen
96.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Musical
96.Credit: Dir: Chris Buck, Jennifer Lee With: Kristen Bell, Idina Menzel, Jonathan Groff
96.Outline: When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister, Anna, teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition.

97.Name: The Little Mermaid
97.Credit: Dir: Ron Clements, John Musker With: Jodi Benson, Samuel E. Wright, Rene Auberjonois
97.Outline: A mermaid princess makes a Faustian bargain with an unscrupulous sea-witch in order to meet a human prince on land.

98.Name: An American Werewolf in London
98.Credit: Dir: John Landis With: David Naughton, Jenny Agutter, Joe Belcher
98.Outline: Two American college students on a walking tour of Britain are attacked by a werewolf that none of the locals will admit exists.

99.Name: Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles
99.Credit: Dir: Neil Jordan With: Brad Pitt, Tom Cruise, Antonio Banderas
99.Outline: A vampire tells his epic life story: love, betrayal, loneliness, and hunger.

100.Name: The Meaning of Life
100.Credit: Dir: Terry Jones, Terry Gilliam With: John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle
100.Outline: The comedy team takes a look at life in all its stages in their own uniquely silly way.

101.Name: The Omen
101.Credit: Dir: Richard Donner With: Gregory Peck, Lee Remick, Harvey Stephens
101.Outline: Mysterious deaths surround an American ambassador. Could the child that he is raising actually be the Antichrist? The Devil's own son?

102.Name: Dead Alive
102.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Timothy Balme, Diana PeÃ±alver, Elizabeth Moody
102.Outline: A young man's mother is bitten by a Sumatran rat-monkey. She gets sick and dies, at which time she comes back to life, killing and eating dogs, nurses, friends, and neighbors.

103.Name: The Evil Dead
103.Credit: Dir: Sam Raimi With: Bruce Campbell, Ellen Sandweiss, Richard DeManincor
103.Outline: Five friends travel to a cabin in the woods, where they unknowingly release flesh-possessing demons.

104.Name: What We Do in the Shadows
104.Credit: Dir: Jemaine Clement, Taika Waititi With: Jemaine Clement, Taika Waititi, Cori Gonzalez-Macuer
104.Outline: Viago, Deacon, and Vladislav are vampires who are finding that modern life has them struggling with the mundane - like paying rent, keeping up with the chore wheel, trying to get into nightclubs, and overcoming flatmate conflicts.

105.Name: Field of Dreams
105.Credit: Dir: Phil Alden Robinson With: Kevin Costner, James Earl Jones, Ray Liotta
105.Outline: An Iowa corn farmer, hearing voices, interprets them as a command to build a baseball diamond in his fields; he does, and the Chicago White Sox come.

106.Name: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer
106.Credit: Dir: Tom Tykwer With: Ben Whishaw, Dustin Hoffman, Alan Rickman
106.Outline: Jean-Baptiste Grenouille, born with a superior olfactory sense, creates the world's finest perfume. His work, however, takes a dark turn as he searches for the ultimate scent.

107.Name: Mulan
107.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Family | Fantasy | Musical | War
107.Credit: Dir: Tony Bancroft, Barry Cook With: Ming-Na Wen, Eddie Murphy, BD Wong
107.Outline: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

108.Name: Pleasantville
108.Credit: Dir: Gary Ross With: Tobey Maguire, Jeff Daniels, Joan Allen
108.Outline: Two 1990s teenagers find themselves in a 1950s sitcom where their influence begins to profoundly change that complacent world.

109.Name: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
109.Credit: Dir: Edgar Wright With: Michael Cera, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Kieran Culkin
109.Outline: Scott Pilgrim must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to win her heart.

110.Name: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
110.Credit: Dir: David Yates With: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
110.Outline: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

111.Name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
111.Credit: Dir: Chris Columbus With: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Richard Harris
111.Outline: Rescued from the outrageous neglect of his aunt and uncle, a young boy with a great destiny proves his worth while attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

112.Name: Pinocchio
112.Credit: Dir: Norman Ferguson, T. Hee With: Dickie Jones, Christian Rub, Mel Blanc
112.Outline: A living puppet, with the help of a cricket as his conscience, must prove himself worthy to become a real boy.

113.Name: The Devil's Backbone
113.Credit: Dir: Guillermo del Toro With: Marisa Paredes, Eduardo Noriega, Federico Luppi
113.Outline: After Carlos, a 12-year-old whose father has died in the Spanish Civil War, arrives at an ominous boy's orphanage he discovers the school is haunted and has many dark secrets that he must uncover.

114.Name: Dracula
114.Credit: Dir: Francis Ford Coppola With: Gary Oldman, Winona Ryder, Anthony Hopkins
114.Outline: The vampire comes to England to seduce a visitor's fiancÃ©e and inflict havoc in the foreign land.

115.Name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
115.Credit: Dir: David Yates With: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
115.Outline: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

116.Name: Suspiria
116.Credit: Dir: Dario Argento With: Jessica Harper, Stefania Casini, Flavio Bucci
116.Outline: A newcomer to a fancy ballet academy gradually comes to realize that the school is a front for something far more sinister and supernatural amidst a series of grisly murders.

117.Name: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
117.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage
117.Outline: Bilbo and Company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness.

118.Name: Beetlejuice
118.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton With: Alec Baldwin, Geena Davis, Michael Keaton
118.Outline: A couple of recently deceased ghosts contract the services of a "bio-exorcist" in order to remove the obnoxious new owners of their house.

119.Name: Across the Universe
119.Credit: Dir: Julie Taymor With: Evan Rachel Wood, Jim Sturgess, Joe Anderson
119.Outline: The music of the Beatles and the Vietnam War form the backdrop for the romance between an upper-class American girl and a poor Liverpudlian artist.

120.Name: Alice in Wonderland
120.Credit: Dir: Clyde Geronimi, Wilfred Jackson With: Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn
120.Outline: Alice stumbles into the world of Wonderland. Will she get home? Not if the Queen of Hearts has her way.

121.Name: Excalibur
121.Credit: Dir: John Boorman With: Nigel Terry, Helen Mirren, Nicholas Clay
121.Outline: Merlin the magician helps Arthur Pendragon unite the Britons around the round table of Camelot even as forces conspire to tear it apart

122.Name: Labyrinth
122.Credit: Dir: Jim Henson With: David Bowie, Jennifer Connelly, Toby Froud
122.Outline: A selfish 16-year old girl is given 13 hours to solve a labyrinth and rescue her baby brother when her wish for him to be taken away is granted by the Goblin King.

123.Name: Eraserhead
123.Credit: Dir: David Lynch With: Jack Nance, Charlotte Stewart, Allen Joseph
123.Outline: Henry Spencer tries to survive his industrial environment, his angry girlfriend, and the unbearable screams of his newly born mutant child.

124.Name: The NeverEnding Story
124.Credit: Dir: Wolfgang Petersen With: Noah Hathaway, Barret Oliver, Tami Stronach
124.Outline: A troubled boy dives into a wonderous fantasy world through the pages of a mysterious book.

125.Name: Arizona Dream
125.Credit: Dir: Emir Kusturica With: Johnny Depp, Jerry Lewis, Faye Dunaway
125.Outline: An Innuit hunter races his sled home with a fresh-caught halibut. This fish pervades the entire film...

126.Name: Poltergeist
126.Credit: Dir: Tobe Hooper With: JoBeth Williams, Heather O'Rourke, Craig T. Nelson
126.Outline: A family's home is haunted by a host of ghosts.

127.Name: Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children
127.Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Fantasy | Sci-Fi | Thriller
127.Credit: Dir: Tetsuya Nomura, Takeshi Nozue With: Takahiro Sakurai, Ayumi ItÃ´, Shotaro Morikubo
127.Outline: An ex-mercenary is forced out of isolation when three mysterious men kidnap and brainwash the city's children afflicted with the Geostigma disease.

128.Name: Carrie
128.Credit: Dir: Brian De Palma With: Sissy Spacek, Piper Laurie, Amy Irving
128.Outline: Carrie White, a shy and outcast 17 year-old girl who is sheltered by her domineering, religious mother, unleashes her telekinetic powers after being humiliated by her classmates at her senior prom.

129.Name: Corpse Bride
129.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton, Mike Johnson With: Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter, Emily Watson
129.Outline: When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her.

130.Name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
130.Credit: Dir: Chris Columbus With: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson
130.Outline: Harry ignores warnings not to return to Hogwarts, only to find the school plagued by a series of mysterious attacks and a strange voice haunting him.

131.Name: Wristcutters: A Love Story
131.Credit: Dir: Goran Dukic With: Patrick Fugit, Shea Whigham, Tom Waits
131.Outline: A film set in a strange afterlife way station that has been reserved for people who have committed suicide.

132.Name: Dogma
132.Credit: Dir: Kevin Smith With: Ben Affleck, Matt Damon, Linda Fiorentino
132.Outline: An abortion clinic worker with a special heritage is called upon to save the existence of humanity from being negated by two renegade angels trying to exploit a loop-hole and reenter Heaven.

133.Name: Monsters University
133.Credit: Dir: Dan Scanlon With: Billy Crystal, John Goodman, Steve Buscemi
133.Outline: A look at the relationship between Mike and Sulley during their days at Monsters University -- when they weren't necessarily the best of friends.

134.Name: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
134.Credit: Dir: Ben Stiller With: Ben Stiller, Kristen Wiig, Jon Daly
134.Outline: When his job along with that of his co-worker are threatened, Walter takes action in the real world embarking on a global journey that turns into an adventure more extraordinary than anything he could have ever imagined.

135.Name: Peter Pan
135.Credit: Dir: Clyde Geronimi, Wilfred Jackson With: Bobby Driscoll, Kathryn Beaumont, Hans Conried
135.Outline: Wendy and her brothers are whisked away to the magical world of Neverland with the hero of their stories, Peter Pan.

136.Name: The Science of Sleep
136.Credit: Dir: Michel Gondry With: Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Miou-Miou
136.Outline: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is love-struck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.

137.Name: The Emperor's New Groove
137.Credit: Dir: Mark Dindal With: David Spade, John Goodman, Eartha Kitt
137.Outline: Emperor Kuzco is turned into a llama by his ex-administrator Yzma, and must now regain his throne with the help of Pacha, the gentle llama herder.

138.Name: Rise of the Guardians
138.Credit: Dir: Peter Ramsey With: Hugh Jackman, Alec Baldwin, Isla Fisher
138.Outline: When the evil spirit Pitch launches an assault on Earth, the Immortal Guardians team up to protect the innocence of children all around the world.

139.Name: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
139.Credit: Dir: Gore Verbinski With: Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley
139.Outline: Jack Sparrow races to recover the heart of Davy Jones to avoid enslaving his soul to Jones' service, as other friends and foes seek the heart for their own agenda as well.

140.Name: Enter the Void
140.Credit: Dir: Gaspar NoÃ© With: Nathaniel Brown, Paz de la Huerta, Cyril Roy
140.Outline: A U.S. drug dealer living in Tokyo is betrayed by his best friend and killed in a drug deal. His soul, observing the repercussions of his death, seeks resurrection.

141.Name: The Hudsucker Proxy
141.Credit: Dir: Joel Coen With: Tim Robbins, Paul Newman, Jennifer Jason Leigh
141.Outline: A naive business graduate is installed as president of a manufacturing company as part of a stock scam.

142.Name: Sleeping Beauty
142.Credit: Dir: Clyde Geronimi With: Mary Costa, Bill Shirley, Eleanor Audley
142.Outline: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

143.Name: Spider-Man 2
143.Credit: Dir: Sam Raimi With: Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Alfred Molina
143.Outline: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

144.Name: Big Trouble in Little China
144.Credit: Dir: John Carpenter With: Kurt Russell, Kim Cattrall, Dennis Dun
144.Outline: An All-American trucker gets dragged into a centuries-old mystical battle in Chinatown.

145.Name: The Secret Garden
145.Credit: Dir: Agnieszka Holland With: Kate Maberly, Maggie Smith, Heydon Prowse
145.Outline: A young British girl born and raised in India loses her neglectful parents in an earthquake. She is returned to England to live at her uncle's estate...

146.Name: The Cat Returns
146.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Romance
146.Credit: Dir: Hiroyuki Morita With: Chizuru Ikewaki, Yoshihiko Hakamada, Aki Maeda
146.Outline: After helping a cat, a young girl finds herself involuntarily engaged to a cat prince in a magical world where her only hope of freedom lies with a dapper cat statuette come to life.

147.Name: Beasts of the Southern Wild
147.Credit: Dir: Benh Zeitlin With: QuvenzhanÃ© Wallis, Dwight Henry, Levy Easterly
147.Outline: Faced with both her hot-tempered father's fading health and melting ice-caps that flood her ramshackle bayou community and unleash ancient aurochs, six-year-old Hushpuppy must learn the ways of courage and love.

148.Name: Cinderella
148.Credit: Dir: Clyde Geronimi, Wilfred Jackson With: Ilene Woods, James MacDonald, Eleanor Audley
148.Outline: When Cinderella's cruel stepmother prevents her from attending the Royal Ball, she gets some unexpected help from the lovable mice Gus and Jaq, and from her Fairy Godmother.

149.Name: The Book of Life
149.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Romance
149.Credit: Dir: Jorge R. GutiÃ©rrez With: Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana, Channing Tatum
149.Outline: Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears.

150.Name: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
150.Credit: Dir: Zack Snyder With: Ben Affleck, Henry Cavill, Amy Adams
150.Outline: Fearing that the actions of Superman are left unchecked, Batman takes on the Man of Steel, while the world wrestles with what kind of a hero it really needs.

151.Name: Big
151.Credit: Dir: Penny Marshall With: Tom Hanks, Elizabeth Perkins, Robert Loggia
151.Outline: When a boy wishes to be big at a magic wish machine, he wakes up the next morning and finds himself in an adult body.

152.Name: From Dusk Till Dawn
152.Credit: Dir: Robert Rodriguez With: Harvey Keitel, George Clooney, Juliette Lewis
152.Outline: Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge in an establishment populated by vampires, with chaotic results.

153.Name: The Croods
153.Credit: Dir: Kirk De Micco, Chris Sanders With: Nicolas Cage, Ryan Reynolds, Emma Stone
153.Outline: After their cave is destroyed, a caveman family must trek through an unfamiliar fantastical world with the help of an inventive boy.

154.Name: Fantasia/2000
154.Credit: Dir: James Algar, GaÃ«tan Brizzi With: James Levine, Steve Martin, Leopold Stokowski
154.Outline: An update of the original film with new interpretations of great works of classical music.

155.Name: Willow
155.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Val Kilmer, Joanne Whalley, Warwick Davis
155.Outline: A reluctant dwarf must play a critical role in protecting a special baby from an evil queen.

156.Name: The Lost Boys
156.Credit: Dir: Joel Schumacher With: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest
156.Outline: After moving to a new town, two brothers discover that the area is a haven for vampires.

157.Name: The Age of Adaline
157.Credit: Dir: Lee Toland Krieger With: Blake Lively, Michiel Huisman, Harrison Ford
157.Outline: A young woman, born at the turn of the 20th century, is rendered ageless after an accident. After many solitary years, she meets a man who complicates the eternal life she has settled into.

158.Name: If Only
158.Credit: Dir: Gil Junger With: Jennifer Love Hewitt, Paul Nicholls, Tom Wilkinson
158.Outline: It takes a tragedy to teach the young businessman Ian to put love ahead of work and open up to his musician girlfriend Samantha.

159.Name: Gremlins
159.Credit: Dir: Joe Dante With: Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton
159.Outline: A boy inadvertently breaks 3 important rules concerning his new pet and unleashes a horde of malevolently mischievous monsters on a small town.

160.Name: The Dark Crystal
160.Credit: Dir: Jim Henson, Frank Oz With: Jim Henson, Kathryn Mullen, Frank Oz
160.Outline: On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal, and so restore order to his world.

161.Name: Hercules
161.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Musical | Romance
161.Credit: Dir: Ron Clements, John Musker With: Tate Donovan, Susan Egan, James Woods
161.Outline: The son of the Greek Gods Zeus and Hera is stripped of his immortality as an infant and must become a true hero in order to reclaim it.

162.Name: Shrek 2
162.Credit: Dir: Andrew Adamson, Kelly Asbury With: Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz
162.Outline: Princess Fiona's parents invite her and Shrek to dinner to celebrate her marriage. If only they knew the newlyweds were both ogres.

163.Name: The Sword in the Stone
163.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Musical
163.Credit: Dir: Wolfgang Reitherman With: Rickie Sorensen, Sebastian Cabot, Karl Swenson
163.Outline: The wizard Merlin teaches a young boy who is destined to be King Arthur.

164.Name: Highlander
164.Credit: Dir: Russell Mulcahy With: Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Clancy Brown
164.Outline: An immortal Scottish swordsman must confront the last of his immortal opponent, a murderously brutal barbarian who lusts for the fabled "Prize".

165.Name: Ruby Sparks
165.Credit: Dir: Jonathan Dayton, Valerie Faris With: Paul Dano, Zoe Kazan, Annette Bening
165.Outline: A novelist struggling with writer's block finds romance in a most unusual way: by creating a female character he thinks will love him, then willing her into existence.

166.Name: Bridge to Terabithia
166.Credit: Dir: Gabor Csupo With: Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel
166.Outline: A preteen's life turns upside down when he befriends the new girl in school and they imagine a whole new fantasy world to escape reality.

167.Name: Paddington
167.Credit: Dir: Paul King With: Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins, Julie Walters
167.Outline: A young Peruvian bear travels to London in search of a home. Finding himself lost and alone at Paddington Station, he meets the kindly Brown family, who offer him a temporary haven.

168.Name: Bubba Ho-Tep
168.Credit: Dir: Don Coscarelli With: Bruce Campbell, Ossie Davis, Ella Joyce
168.Outline: Elvis and JFK, both alive and in nursing homes, fight for the souls of their fellow residents as they battle an ancient Egyptian Mummy.

169.Name: Let Me In
169.Credit: Dir: Matt Reeves With: Kodi Smit-McPhee, ChloÃ« Grace Moretz, Richard Jenkins
169.Outline: A bullied young boy befriends a young female vampire who lives in secrecy with her guardian.

170.Name: In the Mouth of Madness
170.Credit: Dir: John Carpenter With: Sam Neill, JÃ¼rgen Prochnow, Julie Carmen
170.Outline: An insurance investigator begins discovering that the impact a horror writer's books have on his fans is more than inspirational.

171.Name: Man of Steel
171.Credit: Dir: Zack Snyder With: Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon
171.Outline: Clark Kent, one of the last of an extinguished race disguised as an unremarkable human, is forced to reveal his identity when Earth is invaded by an army of survivors who threaten to bring the planet to the brink of destruction.

172.Name: The Adventures of Baron Munchausen
172.Credit: Dir: Terry Gilliam With: John Neville, Eric Idle, Sarah Polley
172.Outline: An account of Baron Munchausen's supposed travels and fantastical experiences with his band of misfits.

173.Name: Brave
173.Credit: Dir: Mark Andrews, Brenda Chapman With: Kelly Macdonald, Billy Connolly, Emma Thompson
173.Outline: Determined to make her own path in life, Princess Merida defies a custom that brings chaos to her kingdom. Granted one wish, Merida must rely on her bravery and her archery skills to undo a beastly curse.

174.Name: Lilo & Stitch
174.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Music | Sci-Fi
174.Credit: Dir: Dean DeBlois, Chris Sanders With: Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere
174.Outline: A Hawaiian girl adopts an unusual pet who is actually a notorious extra-terrestrial fugitive from the law.

175.Name: The Princess and the Frog
175.Credit: Dir: Ron Clements, John Musker With: Anika Noni Rose, Keith David, Oprah Winfrey
175.Outline: A waitress, desperate to fulfill her dreams as a restaurant owner, is set on a journey to turn a frog prince back into a human being, but she has to face the same problem after she kisses him.

176.Name: The Frighteners
176.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Michael J. Fox, Trini Alvarado, Peter Dobson
176.Outline: After a tragic car accident that killed his wife, a man discovers he can communicate with the dead to con people but when a demonic spirit appears, he may be the only one who can stop it from killing the living and the dead.

177.Name: Thirst
177.Credit: Dir: Chan-wook Park With: Kang-ho Song, Ok-bin Kim, Hae-suk Kim
177.Outline: Through a failed medical experiment, a priest is stricken with vampirism and is forced to abandon his ascetic ways.

178.Name: Angel-A
178.Credit: Dir: Luc Besson With: Rie Rasmussen, Jamel Debbouze, Gilbert Melki
178.Outline: A beautiful woman helps an inept scam artist get his game together.

179.Name: Meet Joe Black
179.Credit: Dir: Martin Brest With: Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins, Claire Forlani
179.Outline: Death, who takes the form of a young man, asks a media mogul to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth and in the process he falls in love with his guide's daughter.

180.Name: Enchanted
180.Genre: Animation | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Musical | Romance
180.Credit: Dir: Kevin Lima With: Amy Adams, Susan Sarandon, James Marsden
180.Outline: A princess, who is prepared to be wed, is sent away to New York by an evil queen, where she falls in love with a lawyer.

181.Name: Fright Night
181.Credit: Dir: Tom Holland With: Chris Sarandon, William Ragsdale, Amanda Bearse
181.Outline: When a teenager learns that his next door neighbour is a vampire, no one will believe him.

182.Name: Hotel Transylvania
182.Credit: Dir: Genndy Tartakovsky With: Adam Sandler, Kevin James, Andy Samberg
182.Outline: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the count's teen-aged daughter.

183.Name: Anastasia
183.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Musical | Mystery | Romance
183.Credit: Dir: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman With: Meg Ryan, John Cusack, Christopher Lloyd
183.Outline: The last surviving child of the Russian Royal Family joins two con men to reunite with her grandmother, the Dowager Empress, while the undead Rasputin seeks her death.

184.Name: The Time Traveler's Wife
184.Credit: Dir: Robert Schwentke With: Eric Bana, Rachel McAdams, Ron Livingston
184.Outline: A romantic drama about a Chicago librarian with a gene that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and the complications it creates for his marriage.

185.Name: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
185.Credit: Dir: Gore Verbinski With: Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley
185.Outline: Captain Barbossa, Will Turner and Elizabeth Swann must sail off the edge of the map, navigate treachery and betrayal, and make their final alliances for one last decisive battle.

186.Name: Thor: The Dark World
186.Credit: Dir: Alan Taylor With: Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Tom Hiddleston
186.Outline: When Dr Jane Foster gets cursed with a powerful object, Thor must protect it before an army and its ruthless leader try to get their hands on it to take over the remains of Earth.

187.Name: Arthur Christmas
187.Credit: Dir: Sarah Smith, Barry Cook With: James McAvoy, Jim Broadbent, Bill Nighy
187.Outline: Santa's clumsy son Arthur gets put on a mission with St. Nick's father to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than 2 hours.

188.Name: Mighty Aphrodite
188.Credit: Dir: Woody Allen With: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Pamela Blair
188.Outline: When he discovers his adopted son is a genius, a New York sportswriter seeks out the boy's birth mother: a prostitute.

189.Name: Holy Motors
189.Credit: Dir: Leos Carax With: Denis Lavant, Edith Scob, Eva Mendes
189.Outline: From dawn to dusk, a few hours in the shadowy life of a mystic man named Monsieur Oscar.

190.Name: Ravenous
190.Credit: Dir: Antonia Bird With: Guy Pearce, Robert Carlyle, David Arquette
190.Outline: In a remote military outpost in the 19th Century, Captain John Boyd and his regiment embark on a rescue mission which takes a dark turn when they are ambushed by a sadistic cannibal.

191.Name: The Amazing Spider-Man
191.Credit: Dir: Marc Webb With: Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone, Rhys Ifans
191.Outline: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to solve the mystery of his parent's mysterious death.

192.Name: Hellraiser
192.Credit: Dir: Clive Barker With: Andrew Robinson, Clare Higgins, Ashley Laurence
192.Outline: An unfaithful wife encounters the zombie of her dead lover; demons are pursuing him after he escaped their sadomasochistic underworld.

193.Name: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
193.Credit: Dir: Guillermo del Toro With: Ron Perlman, Selma Blair, Doug Jones
193.Outline: The mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth, so Hellboy and his team must save the world from the rebellious creatures.

194.Name: Thor
194.Credit: Dir: Kenneth Branagh With: Chris Hemsworth, Anthony Hopkins, Natalie Portman
194.Outline: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.

195.Name: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
195.Credit: Dir: Robert Stevenson With: Angela Lansbury, David Tomlinson, Roddy McDowall
195.Outline: An apprentice witch, three kids and a cynical conman search for the missing component to a magic spell useful to the defense of Britain.

196.Name: Maleficent
196.Credit: Dir: Robert Stromberg With: Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley
196.Outline: A vengeful fairy is driven to curse an infant princess, only to discover that the child may be the one person who can restore peace to their troubled land.

197.Name: The Cabin in the Woods
197.Credit: Dir: Drew Goddard With: Kristen Connolly, Chris Hemsworth, Anna Hutchison
197.Outline: Five friends go for a break at a remote cabin in the woods, where they get more than they bargained for. Together, they must discover the truth behind the cabin in the woods.

198.Name: Underworld
198.Credit: Dir: Len Wiseman With: Kate Beckinsale, Scott Speedman, Shane Brolly
198.Outline: Selene, a beautiful vampire warrior, entrenched in a war between the vampire and werewolf races. Although she is aligned with the vampires, she falls in love with Michael, a human who is sought by werewolves for unknown reasons.

199.Name: Fallen
199.Genre: Action | Crime | Drama | Fantasy | Mystery | Thriller
199.Credit: Dir: Gregory Hoblit With: Denzel Washington, John Goodman, Donald Sutherland
199.Outline: Homicide detective John Hobbes witnesses the execution of serial killer Edgar Reese. Soon after the execution the killings start again, and they are very similar to Reese's style.

200.Name: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
200.Credit: Dir: Stephen Hillenburg, Mark Osborne With: Jeffrey Tambor, Rodger Bumpass, Carolyn Lawrence
200.Outline: SpongeBob SquarePants takes leave from the town of Bikini Bottom in order to track down King Neptune's stolen crown.

201.Name: Trollhunter
201.Credit: Dir: AndrÃ© Ãvredal With: Otto Jespersen, Robert Stoltenberg, Knut NÃ¦rum
201.Outline: A group of students investigates a series of mysterious bear killings, but learns that there are much more dangerous things going on. They start to follow a mysterious hunter, learning that he is actually a troll hunter.

202.Name: The Cooler
202.Credit: Dir: Wayne Kramer With: William H. Macy, Maria Bello, Alec Baldwin
202.Outline: In an old school Las Vegas casino, its top gambling jinx breaks his curse when he falls in love, much to his boss' consternation.

203.Name: Cinderella
203.Credit: Dir: Kenneth Branagh With: Lily James, Cate Blanchett, Richard Madden
203.Outline: When her father unexpectedly passes away, young Ella finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother and her scheming step-sisters. Never one to give up hope, Ella's fortunes begin to change after meeting a dashing stranger.

204.Name: Ghost
204.Credit: Dir: Jerry Zucker With: Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Whoopi Goldberg
204.Outline: After an accident leaves a young man dead, his spirit stays behind to warn his lover of impending danger, with the help of a reluctant psychic.

205.Name: What Dreams May Come
205.Credit: Dir: Vincent Ward With: Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding Jr., Annabella Sciorra
205.Outline: After he dies in a car crash, a man searches heaven and hell for his beloved wife.

206.Name: Ted
206.Credit: Dir: Seth MacFarlane With: Mark Wahlberg, Mila Kunis, Seth MacFarlane
206.Outline: John Bennett, a man whose childhood wish of bringing his teddy bear to life came true, now must decide between keeping the relationship with the bear or his girlfriend, Lori.

207.Name: ParaNorman
207.Credit: Dir: Chris Butler, Sam Fell With: Kodi Smit-McPhee, Anna Kendrick, Christopher Mintz-Plasse
207.Outline: A misunderstood boy takes on ghosts, zombies and grown-ups to save his town from a centuries-old curse.

208.Name: Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole
208.Credit: Dir: Zack Snyder With: Jim Sturgess, Hugo Weaving, David Wenham
208.Outline: When a young owl is abducted by an evil Owl army, he must escape with new-found friends and seek the legendary Guardians to stop the menace.

209.Name: The Prince of Egypt
209.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Biography | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Musical
209.Credit: Dir: Brenda Chapman, Steve Hickner With: Val Kilmer, Ralph Fiennes, Michelle Pfeiffer
209.Outline: An Egyptian prince learns of his identity as a Hebrew and, later his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.

210.Name: Scrooged
210.Credit: Dir: Richard Donner With: Bill Murray, Karen Allen, John Forsythe
210.Outline: A selfish, cynical T.V. executive is haunted by three spirits bearing lessons on Christmas Eve.

211.Name: The Mummy
211.Credit: Dir: Stephen Sommers With: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah
211.Outline: An American serving in the French Foreign Legion on an archaeological dig at the ancient city of Hamunaptra accidentally awakens a mummy.

212.Name: Time Bandits
212.Credit: Dir: Terry Gilliam With: Sean Connery, Shelley Duvall, John Cleese
212.Outline: A young boy accidentally joins a band of dwarves as they jump from era to era looking for treasure to steal.

213.Name: Ladyhawke
213.Credit: Dir: Richard Donner With: Matthew Broderick, Rutger Hauer, Michelle Pfeiffer
213.Outline: Philipe Gastone, a thief, escapes from the dungeon at Aquila, sparking a manhunt. He is nearly captured when Captain Navarre befriends him...

214.Name: Constantine
214.Credit: Dir: Francis Lawrence With: Keanu Reeves, Rachel Weisz, Djimon Hounsou
214.Outline: Constantine tells the story of irreverent supernatural detective John Constantine, who has literally been to hell and back.

215.Name: Vanilla Sky
215.Credit: Dir: Cameron Crowe With: Tom Cruise, PenÃ©lope Cruz, Cameron Diaz
215.Outline: A self-indulgent and vain publishing magnate finds his privileged life upended after a vehicular accident with a resentful lover.

216.Name: Triangle
216.Credit: Dir: Christopher Smith With: Melissa George, Joshua McIvor, Jack Taylor
216.Outline: The story revolves around the passengers of a yachting trip in the Atlantic Ocean who, when struck by mysterious weather conditions, jump to another ship only to experience greater havoc on the open seas.

217.Name: The Rescuers
217.Credit: Dir: John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman With: Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor, Geraldine Page
217.Outline: Two mice of the Rescue Aid Society search for a little girl kidnapped by unscrupulous treasure hunters.

218.Name: Elf
218.Credit: Dir: Jon Favreau With: Will Ferrell, James Caan, Bob Newhart
218.Outline: After inadvertently wreaking havoc on the elf community due to his ungainly size, a man raised as an elf at the North Pole is sent to the U.S. in search of his true identity.

219.Name: Peter Pan
219.Credit: Dir: P.J. Hogan With: Jeremy Sumpter, Jason Isaacs, Olivia Williams
219.Outline: The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place.

220.Name: Conan the Barbarian
220.Credit: Dir: John Milius With: Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Earl Jones, Max von Sydow
220.Outline: A vengeful barbarian warrior sets off to avenge his tribe and his parents whom were slain by an evil sorcerer and his warriors when he was a boy.

221.Name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
221.Credit: Dir: Andrew Adamson With: Tilda Swinton, Georgie Henley, William Moseley
221.Outline: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

222.Name: Horton Hears a Who!
222.Credit: Dir: Jimmy Hayward, Steve Martino With: Jim Carrey, Steve Carell, Carol Burnett
222.Outline: Horton the Elephant struggles to protect a microscopic community from his neighbors who refuse to believe it exists.

223.Name: The Rescuers Down Under
223.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Crime | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Mystery
223.Credit: Dir: Hendel Butoy, Mike Gabriel With: Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor, John Candy
223.Outline: The R.A.S. agents, Miss Bianca and Bernard, race to Australia to save a boy and a rare golden eagle from a murderous poacher.

224.Name: Ice Age: The Meltdown
224.Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy
224.Credit: Dir: Carlos Saldanha With: Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary
224.Outline: Manny, Sid, and Diego discover that the ice age is coming to an end, and join everybody for a journey to higher ground. On the trip, they discover that Manny, in fact, is not the last of the woolly mammoths.

225.Name: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
225.Credit: Dir: Ken Hughes With: Dick Van Dyke, Sally Ann Howes, Lionel Jeffries
225.Outline: A down-on-his-luck inventor turns a broken-down Grand Prix car into a fancy vehicle for his children, and then they go off on a magical fantasy adventure to save their grandfather in a far-off land.

226.Name: Jumanji
226.Credit: Dir: Joe Johnston With: Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt
226.Outline: When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped for decades in it and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.

227.Name: Clash of the Titans
227.Credit: Dir: Desmond Davis With: Laurence Olivier, Harry Hamlin, Claire Bloom
227.Outline: A film adaption of the myth of Perseus and his quest to battle both Medusa and the Kraken monster to save the Princess Andromeda.

228.Name: It Follows
228.Credit: Dir: David Robert Mitchell With: Maika Monroe, Keir Gilchrist, Olivia Luccardi
228.Outline: A young woman is followed by an unknown supernatural force after a sexual encounter.

229.Name: The Mask
229.Credit: Dir: Chuck Russell With: Jim Carrey, Cameron Diaz, Peter Riegert
229.Outline: Bank clerk Stanley Ipkiss is transformed into a manic superhero when he wears a mysterious mask.

230.Name: Dog Soldiers
230.Credit: Dir: Neil Marshall With: Sean Pertwee, Kevin McKidd, Emma Cleasby
230.Outline: A routine military exercise turns into a nightmare in the Scotland wilderness.

231.Name: Odd Thomas
231.Credit: Dir: Stephen Sommers With: Anton Yelchin, Ashley Sommers, Leonor Varela
231.Outline: In a California desert town, a short-order cook with clairvoyant abilities encounters a mysterious man with a link to dark, threatening forces.

232.Name: The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus
232.Credit: Dir: Terry Gilliam With: Christopher Plummer, Lily Cole, Heath Ledger
232.Outline: A traveling theater company gives its audience much more than they were expecting.

233.Name: Creepshow
233.Credit: Dir: George A. Romero With: Hal Holbrook, Leslie Nielsen, Adrienne Barbeau
233.Outline: An anthology which tells five terrifying tales based on the E.C. horror comic books of the 1950s.

234.Name: Hellboy
234.Credit: Dir: Guillermo del Toro With: Ron Perlman, Doug Jones, Selma Blair
234.Outline: A demon, raised from infancy after being conjured by and rescued from the Nazis, grows up to become a defender against the forces of darkness.

235.Name: Insidious
235.Credit: Dir: James Wan With: Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Ty Simpkins
235.Outline: A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child in a realm called The Further.

236.Name: Liar Liar
236.Credit: Dir: Tom Shadyac With: Jim Carrey, Maura Tierney, Justin Cooper
236.Outline: A fast track lawyer can't lie for 24 hours due to his son's birthday wish after the lawyer turns his son down for the last time.

237.Name: The Good Dinosaur
237.Credit: Dir: Peter Sohn With: Jeffrey Wright, Frances McDormand, Maleah Nipay-Padilla
237.Outline: In a world where dinosaurs and humans live side-by-side, an Apatosaurus named Arlo makes an unlikely human friend.

238.Name: Ginger Snaps
238.Credit: Dir: John Fawcett With: Emily Perkins, Katharine Isabelle, Kris Lemche
238.Outline: Two death-obsessed sisters, outcasts in their suburban neighborhood, must deal with the tragic consequences when one of them is bitten by a deadly werewolf.

239.Name: Penelope
239.Credit: Dir: Mark Palansky With: Christina Ricci, James McAvoy, Reese Witherspoon
239.Outline: A modern romantic tale about a young aristocratic heiress born under a curse that can only be broken when she finds true love with "one who will love her faithfully."

240.Name: The Boxtrolls
240.Credit: Dir: Graham Annable, Anthony Stacchi With: Ben Kingsley, Jared Harris, Nick Frost
240.Outline: A young orphaned boy raised by underground cave-dwelling trash collectors tries to save his friends from an evil exterminator.

241.Name: The Addams Family
241.Credit: Dir: Barry Sonnenfeld With: Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd
241.Outline: Con artists plan to fleece the eccentric family using an accomplice who claims to be their long lost Uncle Fester.

242.Name: Matilda
242.Credit: Dir: Danny DeVito With: Danny DeVito, Rhea Perlman, Mara Wilson
242.Outline: Story of a wonderful little girl, who happens to be a genius, and her wonderful teacher vs. the worst parents ever and the worst school principal imaginable.

243.Name: A Series of Unfortunate Events
243.Credit: Dir: Brad Silberling With: Jim Carrey, Jude Law, Meryl Streep
243.Outline: When a massive fire kills their parents, three children are delivered to the custody of cousin and stage actor Count Olaf, who is secretly plotting to steal their parents' vast fortune.

244.Name: The Fog
244.Credit: Dir: John Carpenter With: Adrienne Barbeau, Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh
244.Outline: Legend says that Antonio Bay was built in 1880 with blood money obtained from shipwrecked lepers but no one believes it. On the eve of the town's centennial many plan to attend the celebrations, including the murdered lepers.

245.Name: If I Stay
245.Credit: Dir: R.J. Cutler With: ChloÃ« Grace Moretz, Mireille Enos, Jamie Blackley
245.Outline: Life changes in an instant for young Mia Hall after a car accident puts her in a coma. During an out-of-body experience, she must decide whether to wake up and live a life far different than she had imagined. The choice is hers if she can go on.

246.Name: A Christmas Carol
246.Credit: Dir: Robert Zemeckis With: Jim Carrey, Gary Oldman, Colin Firth
246.Outline: An animated retelling of Charles Dickens' classic novel about a Victorian-era miser taken on a journey of self-redemption, courtesy of several mysterious Christmas apparitions.

247.Credit: Dir: Mikael HÃ¥fstrÃ¶m With: John Cusack, Samuel L. Jackson, Mary McCormack
247.Outline: A man who specializes in debunking paranormal occurrences checks into the fabled room 1408 in the Dolphin Hotel. Soon after settling in, he confronts genuine terror.

248.Name: Atlantis: The Lost Empire
248.Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Family | Fantasy | Sci-Fi
248.Credit: Dir: Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise With: Michael J. Fox, Jim Varney, Corey Burton
248.Outline: A young adventurer named Milo Thatch joins an intrepid group of explorers to find the mysterious lost continent of Atlantis.

249.Name: The Lake House
249.Credit: Dir: Alejandro Agresti With: Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock, Christopher Plummer
249.Outline: A lonely doctor who once occupied an unusual lakeside home begins exchanging love letters with its former resident, a frustrated architect. They must try to unravel the mystery behind their extraordinary romance before it's too late.

250.Name: Where the Wild Things Are
250.Credit: Dir: Spike Jonze With: Max Records, Catherine O'Hara, Forest Whitaker
250.Outline: Yearning for escape and adventure, a young boy runs away from home and sails to an island filled with creatures that take him in as their king.

251.Name: Trick 'r Treat
251.Credit: Dir: Michael Dougherty With: Anna Paquin, Brian Cox, Dylan Baker
251.Outline: Five interwoven stories that occur on Halloween: An everyday high school principal has a secret life as a serial killer; a college virgin might have just met the guy for her; a group of teenagers pull a mean prank; a woman who loathes the night has to contend with her holiday-obsessed husband; and a mean old man meets his match with a demonic, supernatural trick-or-treater.

252.Name: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
252.Credit: Dir: Marc Webb With: Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone, Jamie Foxx
252.Outline: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.

253.Name: Sliding Doors
253.Credit: Dir: Peter Howitt With: Gwyneth Paltrow, John Hannah, John Lynch
253.Outline: A London woman's love life and career both hinge, unknown to her, on whether or not she catches a train. We see it both ways, in parallel.

254.Name: Brother Bear
254.Credit: Dir: Aaron Blaise, Robert Walker With: Joaquin Phoenix, Jeremy Suarez, Rick Moranis
254.Outline: When a young Inuit hunter needlessly kills a bear, he is magically changed into a bear himself as punishment with a talkative cub being his only guide to changing back.

255.Name: Underworld: Evolution
255.Credit: Dir: Len Wiseman With: Kate Beckinsale, Scott Speedman, Bill Nighy
255.Outline: Picking up directly from the previous film, vampire warrior Selene and the half werewolf Michael hunt for clues to reveal the history of their races and the war between them.

256.Name: Hotel Transylvania 2
256.Credit: Dir: Genndy Tartakovsky With: Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg, Selena Gomez
256.Outline: Dracula and his friends try to bring out the monster in his half human, half vampire grandson in order to keep Mavis from leaving the hotel.

257.Name: Four Rooms
257.Credit: Dir: Allison Anders, Alexandre Rockwell With: Tim Roth, Amanda De Cadenet, David Proval
257.Outline: Four interlocking tales that take place in a fading hotel on New Year's Eve.

258.Name: The Tree of Life
258.Credit: Dir: Terrence Malick With: Brad Pitt, Sean Penn, Jessica Chastain
258.Outline: The story of a family in Waco, Texas in 1956. The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence and struggles with his parents' conflicting teachings.

259.Name: Innerspace
259.Genre: Action | Adventure | Comedy | Fantasy | Sci-Fi | Thriller
259.Credit: Dir: Joe Dante With: Dennis Quaid, Martin Short, Meg Ryan
259.Outline: A hapless store clerk must foil criminals to save the life of the man who, miniaturized in a secret experiment, was accidentally injected into him.

260.Name: Just Like Heaven
260.Credit: Dir: Mark Waters With: Reese Witherspoon, Mark Ruffalo, Donal Logue
260.Outline: A lonely landscape architect falls for the spirit of the beautiful woman who used to live in his new apartment.

261.Name: Ghost Town
261.Credit: Dir: David Koepp With: Ricky Gervais, Greg Kinnear, TÃ©a Leoni
261.Outline: Bertram Pincus is a man whose people skills leave much to be desired. When Pincus dies unexpectedly, but is miraculously revived after seven minutes, he wakes up to discover that he now has the annoying ability to see ghosts.

262.Name: Bruce Almighty
262.Credit: Dir: Tom Shadyac With: Jim Carrey, Jennifer Aniston, Morgan Freeman
262.Outline: A guy who complains about God too often is given almighty powers to teach him how difficult it is to run the world.

263.Name: James and the Giant Peach
263.Credit: Dir: Henry Selick With: Paul Terry, Joanna Lumley, Pete Postlethwaite
263.Outline: An orphan with terrible aunts for guardians, befriends human like bugs who live inside a giant peach, who take the boy on a journey to New York City.

264.Name: The Family Man
264.Credit: Dir: Brett Ratner With: Nicolas Cage, TÃ©a Leoni, Don Cheadle
264.Outline: A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife.

265.Name: Wanted
265.Credit: Dir: Timur Bekmambetov With: Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy, Morgan Freeman
265.Outline: A frustrated office worker learns that he is the son of a professional assassin, and that he shares his father's superhuman killing abilities.

266.Name: Epic
266.Credit: Dir: Chris Wedge With: Amanda Seyfried, Josh Hutcherson, BeyoncÃ© Knowles
266.Outline: A teenager finds herself transported to a deep forest setting where a battle between the forces of good and the forces of evil is taking place. She bands together with a rag-tag group of characters in order to save their world -- and ours.

267.Name: City of Angels
267.Credit: Dir: Brad Silberling With: Nicolas Cage, Meg Ryan, Andre Braugher
267.Outline: Inspired by the modern classic, Wings of Desire, City involves an angel (Cage) who is spotted by a doctor in an operating room. Franz plays Cage's buddy who somehow knows a lot about angels.

268.Name: All Dogs Go to Heaven
268.Credit: Dir: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman With: Dom DeLuise, Burt Reynolds, Judith Barsi
268.Outline: A dog returns from the dead looking for revenge on his killer using an orphan girl who can talk to animals.

269.Name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
269.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton With: Johnny Depp, Freddie Highmore, David Kelly
269.Outline: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

270.Name: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones
270.Credit: Dir: George Lucas With: Hayden Christensen, Natalie Portman, Ewan McGregor
270.Outline: Ten years after initially meeting, Anakin Skywalker shares a forbidden romance with PadmÃ©, while Obi-Wan investigates an assassination attempt on the Senator and discovers a secret clone army crafted for the Jedi.

271.Name: The Lovely Bones
271.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Rachel Weisz, Mark Wahlberg, Saoirse Ronan
271.Outline: Centers on a young girl who has been murdered and watches over her family - and her killer - from purgatory. She must weigh her desire for vengeance against her desire for her family to heal.

272.Name: The Legend of Bagger Vance
272.Credit: Dir: Robert Redford With: Will Smith, Matt Damon, Charlize Theron
272.Outline: A down-and-out golfer attempts to recover his game and his life with help from a mystical caddy.

273.Name: Puss in Boots
273.Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy
273.Credit: Dir: Chris Miller With: Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Zach Galifianakis
273.Outline: The events leading up to the sword fighting cat's meeting with Shrek and his friends.

274.Name: The Gift
274.Credit: Dir: Sam Raimi With: Cate Blanchett, Katie Holmes, Keanu Reeves
274.Outline: A woman with extrasensory perception is asked to help find a young woman who has disappeared.

275.Name: Hook
275.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Dustin Hoffman, Robin Williams, Julia Roberts
275.Outline: When Captain Hook kidnaps his children, an adult Peter Pan must return to Neverland and reclaim his youthful spirit in order to challenge his old enemy.

276.Name: Home
276.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Family | Fantasy | Sci-Fi
276.Credit: Dir: Tim Johnson With: Jim Parsons, Rihanna, Steve Martin
276.Outline: An alien on the run from his own people makes friends with a girl. He tries to help her on her quest, but can be an interference.

277.Name: This Is the End
277.Credit: Dir: Evan Goldberg, Seth Rogen With: James Franco, Jonah Hill, Seth Rogen
277.Outline: While attending a party at James Franco's house, Seth Rogen, Jay Baruchel and many other celebrities are faced with the apocalypse.

278.Name: Hocus Pocus
278.Credit: Dir: Kenny Ortega With: Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker, Kathy Najimy
278.Outline: After three centuries, three witch sisters are resurrected in Salem, Massachusetts on Halloween night, and it is up to two teenagers, a young girl and an immortal cat to put an end to the witches' reign of terror once and for all.

279.Name: Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas
279.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Romance
279.Credit: Dir: Patrick Gilmore, Tim Johnson With: Brad Pitt, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Joseph Fiennes
279.Outline: The sailor of legend is framed by the goddess Eris for the theft of the Book of Peace, and must travel to her realm at the end of the world to retrieve it and save the life of his childhood friend Prince Proteus.

280.Name: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
280.Credit: Dir: Rob Marshall With: Johnny Depp, PenÃ©lope Cruz, Ian McShane
280.Outline: Jack Sparrow and Barbossa embark on a quest to find the elusive fountain of youth, only to discover that Blackbeard and his daughter are after it too.

281.Name: Monster House
281.Credit: Dir: Gil Kenan With: Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke
281.Outline: Three teens discover that their neighbor's house is really a living, breathing, scary monster.

282.Name: The Odd Life of Timothy Green
282.Credit: Dir: Peter Hedges With: Jennifer Garner, Joel Edgerton, CJ Adams
282.Outline: A childless couple bury a box in their backyard, containing all of their wishes for an infant. Soon, a child is born, though Timothy Green is not all that he appears.

283.Name: Crimson Peak
283.Genre: Drama | Fantasy | Horror | Mystery | Romance | Thriller
283.Credit: Dir: Guillermo del Toro With: Mia Wasikowska, Jessica Chastain, Tom Hiddleston
283.Outline: In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds - and remembers.

284.Name: The Forbidden Kingdom
284.Credit: Dir: Rob Minkoff With: Jackie Chan, Jet Li, Michael Angarano
284.Outline: A discovery made by a kung fu obsessed American teen sends him on an adventure to China, where he joins up with a band of martial arts warriors in order to free the imprisoned Monkey King.

285.Name: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
285.Credit: Dir: Mike Newell With: Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton, Ben Kingsley
285.Outline: A young fugitive prince and princess must stop a villain who unknowingly threatens to destroy the world with a special dagger that enables the magic sand inside to reverse time.

286.Name: The Polar Express
286.Credit: Dir: Robert Zemeckis With: Tom Hanks, Chris Coppola, Michael Jeter
